message.content:
To calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers in Python, you can use the following code:

```python
import numpy as np  # Importing numpy library which provides various mathematical functions

numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]  # List of numbers

average = np.mean(numbers)  # Calculating the average of the numbers
std_dev = np.std(numbers)   # Calculating the standard deviation of the numbers

print("Average: ", average)
print("Standard Deviation: ", std_dev)
```

In this code, `np.mean()` is used to calculate the average and `np.std()` is used to calculate the standard deviation. The list of numbers is passed as an argument to these functions. The results are then printed out.
